result.execSummary:
The defendant Cody L Huffman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Bond amount posted in 22CF30 shall be applied.  lf probation will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due. lf the defendant's probation is revoked with outstanding financial obligations and a jail sentence is ordered at the sentencing after revocation, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due. 

Defendant shall provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis.  Defendant has the right to request expungement of DNA analysis in writing through the Department of Justice.

Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety. 

Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription and then taken as prescribed.  

Defendant shall have no contact with B. S. W.

Defendant shall participate in all counseling, assessments, and/or treatment programs directed by the probation agent and comply with recommendations.  

Defendant shall comply with the Injunction in 22CV27.

timeConds.notes: With Huber privileges consistent with the rules of the jail while the inmate maintains a minimum security status. The defendant, at the discretion of the Sheriff, may perform community service work as an inmate worker in the county jail and shall earn statutory good time for same.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Cody L Huffman

records.addlTxt: Same appearances.  Guilty plea entered.  Court finds def guilty and enters judgment.

Clerk: EZ. Prosecuting attorney Mark David Bensen in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Cody L Huffman in court, in custody.  Attorney William Andrew Mayer in court for Cody L Huffman.  (22CF30 Br. 1; 22CV27)  Preliminary hearing waived.  Court binds defendant over for trial and State shall file an Information.
Reset Hearing from Branch 3 on 4-6-2022 to Branch 1 on April 4, 2022 at 11:00 am for resolution with 22CF30 per Atty. Mayer.
Motion and Demand for Discovery and Inspection

Adjustment Number: 22A 040340,
Payable Number: 164751,
Receipt Number: 22R 004643,
Amount: $20.00
No bars or places that sell alcohol. Absolute sobriety.

Prosecuting Attorney Jeanette Corbett appears in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant appears via video in custody from the Washington County Jail and by Atty. Timothy Drewa in person.  Defendant given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found.  Argument on bond.  $5,000 cash bond set.  Preliminary hearing time limits waived.  Adjourned for position on preliminary hearing.  Defendant has a pending case in another branch.  Atty. Mayer will be representing defendant.
Hearing scheduled for April 6, 2022 at 02:45 pm.
